body: @foryou2030  LGTM, Thanks for working on this.

@QiangCai Good idea. 
+1 for having two maven profiles. One using thrift compiler and one using java code. Also a profile in "format" to copy generated code to "format/format-java"
@zuowang  please refine the PR's title through adding issue number
@zuowang LGTM, thanks for working on this

+1
I think this will also solve the problem that currently IDE could not build carbondata project because of thrift tool dependency.

@QiangCai May not be right time to do changes in data loading part now, as we are working on removing kettle and changing the design of loading data. we already consider of removing dependency of spark-csv  and unifying of csv reader through inputformat.

@ravipesala I have raised one jira for no inverted index scenario but this issue will still come if we fix inverted index scenario https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CARBONDATA-221. Please Assign this issue to some one

@ravipesala 
We can extract a new Inputformat  and RecordReader in the future.

Now it is neccessary to unify Csv reader.
1. Remove code which copied from spark-csv
2. Just need one reader and one parser.
3.To resolve some issue because of the different between dict gen with dataloading
Executor statistics are handled in milliseconds?can u pls put the ref code
@ravikiran23 LGTM, thanks for working on this.
raise Jira for handling data type based support https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CARBONDATA-225

Hi Ajay, Thanks  for addressing the feedback.
The changes looks good to me.

+1
It is not a defect, no need to fixed. Close PR.
CARBONDATA-157 has been resolved in pr#114. close this pr.

CI passed:
http://136.243.101.176:8080/job/ApacheCarbonManualPRBuilder/169
@ravipesala @kumarvishal09 @manishgupta88 
pls help to check this pr, whether this modifacation is proper that after restart cluster data mismatch would happen again?  Thank you!
And in my local test when restart cluster, it would not be happen again.
Please do not merge now, still there are test case failure need to solve

Looks great!
I have one query: Supposed there are many columns(100+), how to automatically get columns' definition, to avoid one by one input again with the below script, because load data already did the works.

```
    | CREATE TEMPORARY TABLE source
    | (c1 string, c2 string, c3 long)
    | USING org.apache.spark.sql.CarbonSource
    | OPTIONS (path './examples/target/store/default/carbon1',       // file path
  """.stripMargin)
```

this is good idea to get rid of CarbonContext and go back to normal SqlContext..  for the writing part, the new design for data loading will handle the case of saving a DF to Carbon table without using CarbonContext? 

for the reading part, in the future, we can add following df API integration, so that there is no need to supply table schema/option at the time of querying it, those info (schema, carbon properties) can be retrieved from the meta data of the table root path. 
df = sqlContext.read.format("Carbon").options("Carbon options").load(" path/to/carbon file")
df.registerTempTable()

I noticed Spark 2.0 has introduced new API for registering temporary table..
@foryou2030 ....There are few constants in this file with same value but different name...can you remove those constants also from this file....

@JihongMA Yes, for the write part we should refactor to use SqlContext after new flow of data loading is complete. For the read part, yes you are right, I plan to add the support to read schema from table path, such that user is not required to give schema in create table DDL

@JihongMA @chenliang613 added support for create table without providing schema

```
    sqlContext.sql(
      """
        | CREATE TEMPORARY TABLE source
        | USING org.apache.spark.sql.CarbonSource
        | OPTIONS (path './examples/target/store/default/carbon1',       // file path
      """.stripMargin)
```

verified ok: don't need to provide schema,  can automatically get metadata information.

LGTM
handled build failure issue as a part of this PR
LGTM, merged to master, @kumarvishal09 Raise separate PR for branch_0.1 also

@ManoharVanam Currently we don't support parallel data loads per table. Expected parallel operations behavior for each table is
dataloaddeletecompactioncleanup
dataload NYYY
delete YNYY
compactionYYNY
cleanup YYYN
looks good, please add test case.
Invalid segment deletion, need not be through CarbonInputFormat, When Invalid segments list given to Btree(both in Driver and executor it should able it delete invalid blocks).
LGTM. If possible please add the snap shot of driver statistics :)
